intro: Glossostelma mbisiense, commonly known as the Mbisi starflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the humid lowland forests of western Kenya. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Glossostelma mbisiense is adapted to thrive in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing in the understory of dense tropical forests.
